user_message:
<misra_rule>
The target MISRA C 2023 Rule 2.1 is: A project shall not contain unreachable code.

</misra_rule>
<instruction>
Other agents will judge whether the code follows the MISRA C 2023 guidelines.
They will investigate the code fragments you give.
Your job is to find code fragments in the code that should be investigated to check whether the code follows the MISRA C rule.
</instruction>
<response format>
Provide your answer with these fields.
- suspicious_frags: The list of suspicious code fragments in the code.
It should contain only the code fragments exists in the code. If you do not find any suspicious code fragments, return an empty list for suspicious_frags
- explanation: The explanation of why other code fragments should NOT be investigated.
It is very important to not miss any suspicious code fragments, so please give a sufficient explanation why other code fragments should not be investigated.
DO NOT give any explanation for the selected suspicious code fragments.
</response format>
<target_code>
Here is the code of run_usock:
```c
static void *
run_usock (void *cls)
{
  struct MyData *md = cls;
  struct MHD_UpgradeResponseHandle *urh = md->urh;
  char buf[128];
  ssize_t got;

  make_blocking (md->sock);
  /* start by sending extra data MHD may have already read, if any */
  if (0 != md->extra_in_size)
  {
    send_all (md->sock,
              md->extra_in,
              md->extra_in_size);
    free (md->extra_in);
  }
  /* now echo in a loop */
  while (1)
  {
    got = recv (md->sock,
                buf,
                sizeof (buf),
                0);
    if (0 >= got)
      break;
    send_all (md->sock,
              buf,
              (size_t) got);
  }
  free (md);
  MHD_upgrade_action (urh,
                      MHD_UPGRADE_ACTION_CLOSE);
  return NULL;
}
```
</target_code>
Please find suspicious code fragments in the code and report them. Other agents can not investigate other fragments that you do not report, so it is very important to find all suspicious fragments without missing any. Report the suspicious fragments AS MUCH AS POSSIBLE.
explanation:
No syntactically unreachable code fragments were found in the function. Reasoning: 
- There is no unconditional return, goto, longjmp, or abort that would make later statements unreachable. The final return NULL is reachable. 
- The while (1) loop contains a conditional break (if (0 >= got) break;), so control can and does flow out of the loop to the subsequent free(md), MHD_upgrade_action(...), and return. The loop is not an unconditional infinite loop from a static-analysis perspective. 
- The if (0 != md->extra_in_size) block is conditional and therefore not statically unreachable; it may or may not execute at runtime depending on md->extra_in_size. 
- There are no unreachable case labels, dead code after a non-void return, or statements following an unconditional jump. 
Given these points, there are no code regions that appear statically unreachable and therefore no fragments need to be investigated for MISRA C 2023 Rule 2.1 in this function.
